thread.title: GM's quarterly earnings rise fourfold in Q2
thread.title_full: GM's quarterly earnings rise fourfold in Q2 | MENAFN.COM

title: GM's quarterly earnings rise fourfold in Q2
text:
(MENAFN) General Motors said that its quarterly earnings increased fourfold driven by solid sales in the US and China as it pledged better results in the second half of the year, Oman Observer reported.

Earnings were USD1.1 billion, up from USD278 million on-year. The 2014 second-quarter earnings were depressed by USD1.2 billion in elevated costs for car recalls after an ignition-switch scandal.

The biggest US automaker said its second-quarter results were driven by improved profit margins in the key North America region, as well as strong sales in China despite concerns about slowing economy.

Meanwhile, revenue dropped 3.7 percent to USD38.18 billion, attributed to the strong dollar, while operating earnings in North America doubled to USD2.8 billion, setting a quarterly record.
